nodes.bodyText: if this becomes a marker interface only, do we still need it ?
yeah, this is the type we use in  RequestContext for fragment metadata
let's mention the soft references ensure the instances in the queue should get deleted when there's a GC memory pressure
are we sure we don't need to reset the classloader back to what it was before ?
It's not necessary, the classloader will always be set when we borrow the kryo object. No need to have the kryo classloader set when they are in the pool waiting to be consumed

yea, I guess it would be needed if we were to unload the web app so that they can be GC-ed, but probably not that important for Boot, and maybe even setting the class loader in the first place is not necessary as all the class loaders will be the same, no ?
maybe, but I think it's okay to keep it as is
this is no longer a JSON (variable name) :)
do we need to release kryo here ?
done
are we still using thread locals ? I thought we now use KryoPool ?
we should use Kryo from the pool here, I'll fix it
Should we use named constants here? I am assuming this is 4kb and 10MB but I could be wrong.
I think we were using named constants, not sure at what point that changed

Is the encoding done by the writeClassAndObject() call or the writeBinary() call? It seems odd that serialize doesn't have an explicit call to encode to Base64 but that deserialize does have a call to decode.
encoding is done by jackson, so that means it's done in writeBinary
It doesn't look like the class as setters generated. Did we need to remove the final modifiers because of how kyro does serialization and deserialization?
we need to remove final because of the @NoArgsConstructor which is required by kryo
Echoing my comment from HBaseFragmentMetadata above.
again, we need it for the constructor with no arguments
Context question: did some other code change require a change in this methods signature?
